title: UltraTech Cements receives green flag from CCI to acquire majority stake in India Cements | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
UltraTech Cements Receives Approval to Acquire Majority Stake in India Cements

Date: Friday, [Date not specified] Source: PTI

UltraTech Cement has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a majority stake in India Cements, expanding its presence in the southern cement market.

  • The CCI granted UltraTech a license to acquire up to 26% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • UltraTech's proposed acquisition includes a 32.72% stake from the promoters of India Cements.
  • The approval was facilitated by J Sagar Associates, legal advisors to UltraTech.
  • This move is part of UltraTech's strategy to enhance its operations in Tamil Nadu, a rapidly growing market.
"Competition Commission of India (CCI) approves UltraTech Cement Ltd's acquisition of India Cements Ltd," the competition watchdog stated.

As of now, UltraTech leads the Indian cement market with a capacity of 156.66 million tonnes of grey cement per annum.
newTitle: UltraTech Cements Receives Approval to Acquire Majority Stake in India Cements

title: Novo Nordisk shares plunge after CagriSema obesity drug trial disappoints - Reuters
RBI fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 lakh over non-compliance | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
RBI Fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 Lakh for Non-Compliance

Publication Date: November 20, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹27 lakh on IndusInd Bank Ltd. for failing to comply with regulatory norms by opening savings accounts for ineligible entities.

  • The monetary penalty amounts to ₹27.30 lakh.
  • The RBI's inspection revealed non-compliance with the 'Reserve Bank of India (Interest Rate on Deposits) Directions, 2016.'
  • The inspection assessed the bank's financial position as of March 31, 2023.
  • The penalty does not affect the validity of any transactions made by the bank with its customers.
  • IndusInd Bank reported a 39.5% YoY decline in consolidated net profit for the July-September quarter.
“RBI found, inter alia, that the charge pertaining to opening of certain savings deposit accounts in the name of ineligible entities was sustained, warranting imposition of monetary penalty,” the statement said.

This fine underscores the importance of regulatory compliance in the banking sector and aims to ensure that banks operate within prescribed guidelines to protect consumers and maintain a robust financial system.
newTitle: RBI Fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 Lakh for Non-Compliance

title: Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026 - CarDekho
summary:
Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026

Publication Date: N/A | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros is set to potentially launch its all-electric version in India by 2026, competing with other EVs like Tata Nexon EV and Mahindra XUV400 EV, and expected to offer a driving range of approximately 400 km.

  • The Syros EV will likely be based on the reinforced K1 platform.
  • Design updates may include EV-specific features like revised bumpers.
  • The cabin layout will remain largely unchanged with EV-specific accents.
  • Expected pricing starts from Rs 15 lakh (ex-showroom).
“Although Kia is yet to reveal the battery pack and electric motor specifications for the Syros EV, we expect it to offer a claimed driving range of around 400 km.”

The Syros EV aims to incorporate the familiar features of its ICE counterpart while introducing elements unique to electric vehicles, marking a significant shift in Kia's offerings in the Indian market.
newTitle: Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026

summary:
Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth

Date: October 2024 Source: Economic Times

The Nifty 50 index ended with significant losses, marking its worst week of 2024 and leading to a loss of nearly ₹19 lakh crore in investor wealth.

  • The Nifty 50 index dropped over 350 points on Friday.
  • 48 out of 50 Nifty stocks ended the week with losses.
  • The Sensex lost nearly 1,200 points during the same period.
  • IT stocks declined despite positive guidance from Accenture Plc.
  • Global market concerns from the US Federal Reserve's hawkish outlook affected investor sentiment.
  • Some stocks hit 52-week lows, including Reliance Industries and Tata Consumer Products.
  • Experts are watching critical support levels for potential market rebounds.
“The market has been going through a little bit of turmoil... but in case, these levels do not hold, then I think that is a further slide towards 23,200 to 22,500.” - Vaishali Parekh, Prabhudas Lilladher

In conclusion, while the current market conditions are challenging, experts suggest a potential recovery, driven by government expenditure in the upcoming months.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth

title: Stock market crash: Sensex cracks over 1200 points; 5 factors why the Indian stock market is falling | Stock Market News - Mint
Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs - NDTV Profit
summary:
Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

In a recent interview, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan attributed the rise in bank non-performing assets (NPAs) to corruption during the UPA government. He commended the Modi administration for its efforts in resolving these issues and helping banks recover.

  • Rajan claims UPA-era corruption was a primary cause of NPAs.
  • He recounted a conversation with Arun Jaitley regarding the need to address bad loans.
  • Post-financial crisis challenges included project troubles and regulatory delays.
  • Rajan emphasized the need for a thorough asset quality review of banks to identify bad loans.
  • He highlighted the importance of bank cleanups to restore lending capabilities.
"It was necessary to clean up the system; otherwise lending would be hampered." - Raghuram Rajan

This analysis by Rajan underscores the importance of accountability and systematic reform in addressing long-standing financial issues in India's banking sector.
newTitle: Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs

Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700 - The Times of India
summary:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700

Date: Today
Source: Times of India

Indian equity benchmark indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 faced significant declines today, dipping below 78,500 and just above 23,700 respectively. Key factors include recent comments from the US Federal Reserve affecting investor confidence.

  • BSE Sensex declined by 836 points (1.06%) to 78,382.17.
  • Nifty50 dropped by 241 points (1.01%) to 23,710.95.
  • Foreign investors sold shares worth 122.31 billion rupees ($1.44 billion) this week.
  • Weekly declines of both indices exceed 3%, marking the first drop after four weeks of gains.
  • Top gainers included Asian Paints, Nestle India, and Titan Company, while major losers were Tech Mahindra and Axis Bank.
“Despite the weakness, oversold conditions and resilience in select pockets present buying opportunities.” - Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking

In conclusion, the current pressure on the stock market can be attributed to global economic conditions, particularly the US Federal Reserve's recent statements on interest rates, prompting caution among investors.
newTitle: Stock Market Update: BSE Sensex Drops Over 800 Points, Nifty50 Nears 23,700

title: Waaree Energies, NTPC Green and other renewable energy stocks tumble this week; check details - Upstox
NTPC Green, Waaree Energies, Inox Wind, Adani Green: How renewable energy stocks performed this week - Upstox
summary:
Waaree Energies, NTPC Green and other renewable energy stocks tumble this week; check details

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: Upstox

This week saw significant declines in the stock prices of major renewable energy companies, despite their announcements regarding new facilities and orders.

  • NTPC Green Energy shares fell by 8.64% to ₹131.
  • KPI Green Energy managed a 1.2% increase, closing at ₹802.
  • Adani Green Energy shares plunged 13.69% to ₹1,030.
  • Waaree Energies shares dropped 10.5% to ₹2,871.
  • Premier Energies saw a slight increase of 0.12%, closing at ₹1,296.
“On the basis of certificate dated 18 December 2024 issued by Gujarat Energy Development Agency, second part capacity of 30 MW out of 150 MW Gujarat Solar PV Project is declared on commercial operation.”

Despite positive announcements in the sector, overall market conditions have led to a week of poor performance for renewable energy stocks.
newTitle: Renewable Energy Stocks Decline Despite New Announcements

title: If you share your Amazon Prime Video account with your family, there are 2 new rules you should know about - India Today
summary:
Amazon has two new rules that you should know about if you share your Amazon Prime account with friends or family.

Published On: Dec 20, 2024 | Published By: Nandini Yadav

Starting January 2025, Amazon Prime subscribers who share their accounts will face new restrictions on device logins that limit streaming capabilities.

  • Users can log in to a maximum of 5 devices, with only 2 allowed to be televisions.
  • Subscribers can remove and replace up to 2 devices every 30 days.
  • The aim is to enhance account security and manage device sharing more effectively.
“As part of your Prime membership, you and your household are entitled to enjoy Prime Video on up to five devices.”

The new policy comes as Amazon adjusts its service terms in India, following in the footsteps of similar restrictions from other streaming services.
newTitle: Amazon Prime Video Users: Important Changes to Device Sharing Rules Coming in 2025

title: Google Layoffs: Sundar Pichai announces major job cuts, 10% of managerial roles to be eliminated, report says - Hindustan Times
summary:
Google Announces Major Layoffs, Cutting 10% of Managerial Roles

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Amid increasing competition in the AI sector, Google has announced significant job cuts, eliminating 10% of its managerial roles as part of an effort to enhance operational efficiency.

  • CEO Sundar Pichai disclosed the layoffs during an all-hands meeting.
  • This decision affects directors and VPs as part of a broader restructuring initiative.
  • The layoff process has been ongoing since 2022, with previous cuts affecting over 12,000 employees.
  • Pichai emphasized the need to focus on 'Googleyness,' clarifying key principles such as mission-driven work and teamwork.
  • The tech industry is witnessing a trend of streamlining operations in response to the growing influence of AI.
“The time has come for Google to focus more on updating modern Google.”

This latest round of layoffs reflects Google's ongoing strategy to remain competitive in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.
newTitle: Google Announces Major Layoffs, Cutting 10% of Managerial Roles

title: Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained - CNBCTV18
summary:
Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Siemens India Ltd. have seen a significant fall of up to 8% following comments made during a post-earnings call regarding the state of private capital expenditure.

  • Shares are currently down 13% from their recent peak.
  • Private capex has not shown meaningful improvement overall.
  • Strong demand noted in the energy business, particularly in the transmission segment due to renewables.
  • Company not participating in LCC tenders but remains active in the VSC segment.
  • Digital industries facing challenges due to semiconductor shortages and destocking.
  • Current trading price is ₹7,047, down from a peak of ₹8,129.
Management expects recovery in the digital industries business in the coming quarters.

The decline in Siemens India's shares reflects broader challenges in private capital expenditure and supply chain disruptions; however, growth in certain sectors offers a glimmer of hope.
newTitle: Siemens India Shares Experience Significant Decline - Analysis

Bengaluru techie calls out manager on LinkedIn for tracking breaks, unrealistic workload - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru techie calls out manager on LinkedIn for tracking breaks, unrealistic workload

Published: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Bengaluru-based techie has publicly criticized his former manager for creating a toxic work environment after being terminated from his job. His LinkedIn post details experiences with micromanagement, unrealistic workloads, and lack of support.

  • The employee worked in an American workforce management company’s Indian office.
  • He claimed micromanagement, including tracking break times, made the work environment stressful.
  • He noted receiving unrealistic workloads, being expected to manage 35–40 cases a week without adequate support.
  • His termination occurred within four months of joining the company, which he attributed to these oppressive conditions.
“When I raised concerns about the extended hours and sought guidance on managing my workload, I was met with dismissive responses like, ‘You have to solve your open cases anyhow, any way you prefer.’”

This incident highlights ongoing discussions about workplace culture and management practices in the tech industry, particularly in the context of employee well-being and support.
newTitle: Techie Calls Out Manager for Unfair Practices on LinkedIn
